question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes. Please help me implement this SVG image using code. Magnet has attraction on metal due to magnetic science.

checklist.title: Is the basic SVG magnet visualization implemented correctly?
checklist.description: Check if the code properly creates an SVG magnet with appropriate shapes, colors, and proportions. The classic horseshoe or bar magnet shape should be clearly recognizable with proper north/south poles indicated. Score 0 if no magnet is visualized, 5 if a basic shape is present but lacks detail, and 10 if the magnet is properly detailed with visual cues for polarity.

checklist.title: Does the code demonstrate magnetic attraction with metal objects?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code implements a visual demonstration of magnetic attraction physics. Check for metal objects that respond to the magnet's proximity with appropriate movement behaviors. Deduct 5 points if attraction is static/predetermined instead of dynamic, and 3 points if the interaction radius isn't proportional to magnetic strength. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there a magnetic field visualization?
checklist.description: Assess if the code includes a visual representation of magnetic field lines showing the direction and intensity of the magnetic field (typically curved lines from north to south pole). Score 0 if no field lines exist, 5 if basic static field lines are present, and 10 if the field lines dynamically respond to movement or interaction with metal objects.

checklist.title: Is there an interactive component that demonstrates magnetic principles?
checklist.description: Review whether the code allows user interaction (drag-and-drop functionality, mouse hover effects) that demonstrates magnetic science principles like attraction/repulsion based on polarity, distance-based field strength, or interaction between multiple magnets/metal objects. Deduct 5 points if interaction is limited to basic dragging without physics, and 3 points if educational aspects of magnetism aren't clearly conveyed. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser resize, rapid user interactions, out-of-bounds dragging, etc.) and provide friendly error handling or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Magnetic field strength visualization that changes with distance 2. Particle effects showing magnetic attraction 3. Educational tooltips explaining magnetic principles). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar magnetic effects 2. Function modules unrelated to magnetism demonstration 3. Fancy effects that affect performance without adding educational value about magnetism. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core magnetic demonstration is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating physics simulation/view/interaction layers), code organization, and efficiency of the implementation. Deduct 5 points if global variable pollution is found or proper event handling patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code is unnecessarily complex or has high duplication; deduct 5 points if the SVG implementation uses inefficient techniques. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional scientific visualization standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG visualization follows professional scientific visualization principles: 1) Accurate representation of magnetic phenomena 2) Clear visual distinction between magnets, metal objects, and field lines 3) Professional color scheme that aids understanding rather than confuses. Deduct 3 points for each inaccurate scientific representation, 5 points for confusing visual elements, and 5 points for poor color choices that hinder understanding. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and scientifically accurate?
checklist.description: Judge whether the magnetic interactions conform to real physical principles: 1) Force calculations based on realistic magnetic formulas 2) Smooth animations for attraction/repulsion (60fps) 3) Accurate behavior of metal objects in magnetic fields. Deduct 5 points for each physically inaccurate behavior, 3 points for jerky animations during interactions, and 5 points for unrealistic object movements. The full score is 10 points.
